entry.title: Pashinyan appoints two new cabinet members

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan appoints two new cabinet members
media:group.media:description:
üìç Armenia‚Äôs Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan announced two new ministerial appointments, naming Arpine Sargsyan as Armenia's new Interior Minister and Armavir Governor Davit Khudatyan as Minister of Territorial Administration and Infrastructure. üìç German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock met with her Armenian counterpart Ararat Mirzoyan in Yerevan to discuss bilateral cooperation, Armenia‚Äôs relations with the European Union, and the ongoing Armenia-Azerbaijan normalization talks. üìç The Council of Europe's Advisory Committee for the Protection of National Minorities called on Azerbaijan to create conditions for the safe return of displaced Karabakh Armenians and to protect Armenian cultural heritage. üìç How Armenia is preparing to navigate the new Trump era: https://youtu.be/ajX0gKmJVlg?si=vnkHqEwGTVp-Q958
#CivilNet #’ç’´’æ’´’¨’Ü’•’© #dailyarmenia

entry.title: Aurora forum addresses climate justice and corporate responsibility

media:group.media:title: Aurora forum addresses climate justice and corporate responsibility
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
The Aurora Humanitarian Initiative hosted a panel on climate change and environmental justice during its Human Rights and Humanitarian Forum in Los Angeles in May, 2024. Organized in collaboration with UCLA‚Äôs Promise Institute for Human Rights, the program gathered together attorneys, businessmen, and environmental activists for a discussion on a key question - how to hold governments, corporations, and individuals accountable for environmental destruction.

entry.title: Pashinyan meets with Pope Francis in Vatican City

media:group.media:title: Pashinyan meets with Pope Francis in Vatican City
media:group.media:description:
üìç U.S. Representative Frank Pallone faced government-sponsored protests and was deliberately excluded from a bipartisan meeting with Azerbaijani President Aliyev during the ongoing COP29 climate conference in Baku. üìç Ludwig Gulnazaryan, the mayor of Parakar, a town near Yerevan, resigned yesterday after reportedly being involved in a deadly shooting over the weekend. He is not suspected of murder. üìç Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan met with Pope Francis at the Vatican yesterday for private discussions centered on regional peace and Armenian prisoners of war.

entry.title: How Armenia is preparing to navigate the new Trump era

media:group.media:title: How Armenia is preparing to navigate the new Trump era
media:group.media:description:
In this CivilNet podcast, political analyst Eric Hacopian provides in-depth analysis of two major developments shaping Armenia's political landscape - the government's surprise dismissal of six ministers in a single day, and the implications of Donald Trump's election victory in the United States. Hacopian examines the motivations behind the ministerial purge, the broader patterns of turnover in Armenian politics, and what these upheavals signal about the country's precarious position. The discussion then pivots to exploring how Trump's presidency could impact Armenia's diplomatic and strategic interests.

entry.title: Cox Rehabilitation Center moves operations from Artsakh to Armenia

media:group.media:title: Cox Rehabilitation Center moves operations from Artsakh to Armenia
media:group.media:description:
The Caroline Cox Rehabilitation Center, which had been operating in Artsakh for 25 years, has moved to Armenia. Their current work focuses around visiting homes and providing rehabilitation treatments to those injured during the ethnic cleansing in Artsakh Additionally, in collaboration with UNICEF, they are working with one hundred children with mental and physical challenges. On October 30, the center acquired a large building in Yeghvard, Armenia, in order to continue their work long-term.

entry.title: S√©curit√©: Pr√©parer les habitants des villages √† la fronti√®re Arm√©nie-Azerba√Ødjan au premier secours

media:group.media:title: S√©curit√©: Pr√©parer les habitants des villages √† la fronti√®re Arm√©nie-Azerba√Ødjan au premier secours
media:group.media:description:
Le conflit entre l‚ÄôArm√©nie et l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan est loin d‚Äô√™tre termin√©. Le Pr√©sident de l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan, Ilham Aliyev, ne cesse de menacer l‚ÄôArm√©nie d‚Äôune guerre sur son territoire. Si la situation est tendue √† Erevan, elle l‚Äôest encore plus dans les villages √† la fronti√®re avec l‚Äôadversaire. Parfois positionn√© √† moins d‚Äôun kilom√®tre de l‚Äôadversaire, les villages arm√©niens sont la cible parfaite pour l‚ÄôAzerba√Ødjan. L‚Äôassociation Armenia Peace Initiative, une organisation fran√ßaise qui se concentre sur la s√©curit√©, a mis en place un protocole de premier secours dans les villages limitrophes. Patrick Aprile, ancien officier de l‚Äôarm√©e fran√ßaise et responsable en Arm√©nie des projets de l‚Äôassociation est l'invit√©e de CivilNet pour en dire davantage sur la situation aux fronti√®res.

entry.title: Senior Armenian judiciary, law enforcement officials resign

media:group.media:title: Senior Armenian judiciary, law enforcement officials resign
media:group.media:description:
üìç Several high-ranking Armenian officials handed in their resignations, as requested by the country‚Äôs prime minister, Nikol Pashinyan. üìç U.S. Senators Sheldon Whitehouse and Ed Markey said they support Armenia during a press conference in Baku, calling for the return of Armenians to Nagorno-Karabakh. üìç Armenian armed forces are participating in the Olympic Cooperation 24 military exercises in Greece alongside forces from eight other nations, including France, Georgia, and Cyprus. üìç Armenia‚Äôs uphill battle for police reform: https://youtu.be/muq-Movl6Yk
